document_title: Pneumonia: Causes, signs, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Pneumonia is an inflammatory phenomenon of the lung parenchyma including inflammation of the alveoli, alveolar sacs, alveolar ducts, interstitial connective tissue and terminal bronchiolitis. The alveoli, the air passages in the lungs, can fill with fluid or pus, causing a cough with phlegm or pus, fever, chills and difficulty breathing. Usually, there are many factors that cause pneumonia, but it is often caused by bacteria, viruses and fungi. Pneumonia has many different levels from mild inflammation to severe pneumonia. The disease is especially dangerous for infants, young children and people over 65 years old with many underlying diseases or weakened immune systems. (first)
Pneumonia can be classified in many different ways depending on the cause and purpose of classification, but in general, pneumonia is mainly classified based on the cause of pneumonia and the source of infection.
1.1 Classification of pneumonia according to the cause of the disease
Bacterial pneumonia; Viral pneumonia; Fungal pneumonia; Chemical pneumonia
1.2. Classification of pneumonia according to infectious cause
Hospital pneumonia; Community-acquired pneumonia
Pneumonia is dangerous for children and adults over 60 years old with underlying diseases
